column4: hi, can someone tell me why the packages   linux-backports-modules-karmic linux-backports-modules-karmic-generic are kept back when upgrading ?
are you upgrading to karmic?
I've upgraded some time ago already, but I need to upgrade these packages
well, the backports aren't installed (or used) unless you need them, so my guess is just that your computer doesn't need the kernel backports
most don't.
I am running an eee which needs the wlan module. I did this on jaunty, and now I need this on karmic to get wifi
try sudo apt-get -f upgrade <package>
ok, thanks
linux-backports-modules-karmic: Depends: linux-backports-modules-karmic-generic (= 2.6.31.11.22) but 2.6.31.10.21 is to be installed
how long ago did you do an apt-get update?
a couple of hours ago
it looks like the older version is pending to be installed...
what does that mean ?
what do I need to do
well, from the message, it looks like the older version is pending an install...
what happens if you do 'sudo aptitude safe-upgrade'?
does it show packages to be upgraded?
The following packages have been kept back:
don't actually say "yes", but what happens if you do 'sudo aptitude dist-upgrade'?
it looks like the packages are somehow broken
ideally, you want to use aptitude as much as possible instead of apt-get
may i PM you to prevent the channel from being flooded?
sure, no need to ask
